title: How to Turn Off O2 Voicemail (3 Working Methods)

steps.title: Open the Phone app.
steps.content: Open the Phone app. You're going to make a phone call to an automated service, so open your preferred phone app to the keypad.

steps.title: Dial "1760" and press the "Call" button.
steps.content: Dial "1760" and press the "Call" button. Using the keypad, dial 1760 . You may hear a "Your voicemail has been turned off" message before the call ends.

steps.title: Test that your voicemail is off.
steps.content: Test that your voicemail is off. Call your phone from another number and listen for your voicemail. If your voicemail was not turned off, try using the Android or iPhone method for disabling your voicemail manually. You can re-dial 1760 to turn your voicemail back on. If you previously had, or still have, the app TuGo on your device, it may prevent you from turning off your voicemail. To fix this, open the app on your phone (re-download it if necessary) and go to Settings > Turn off Voicemail . [1] X Research source

steps.title: Open the Phone app.
steps.content: Open the Phone app. You're going to make a phone call to an automated service, so open your preferred phone app to the keypad.

steps.title: Dial "404" and press the "Call" button.
steps.content: Dial "404" and press the "Call" button. You may or may not hear a "Your voicemail has been disabled" message before the line disconnects.

steps.title: Test that your voicemail is off.
steps.content: Test that your voicemail is off. Call your phone from another number and listen for your voicemail. If it still has not turned off, try the steps to call 404 again before getting in touch with O2 customer support.

steps.title: Open the Phone app.
steps.content: Open the Phone app. You're going to make a phone call to an automated service, so open your preferred phone app to the keypad.

steps.title: Tap ⋮.
steps.content: Tap ⋮ . It's in the top right corner of the screen as long as you see the keypad. If you don't see the keypad, tap Keypad at the bottom of your screen.

steps.title: Tap Settings.
steps.content: Tap Settings . This is usually the last option in the menu.

steps.title: Tap Voicemail.
steps.content: Tap Voicemail . You might need to scroll down to find this option that's toward the bottom of the menu.

steps.title: Tap Visual Voicemail and make sure it's disabled.
steps.content: Tap Visual Voicemail and make sure it's disabled. If it's still enabled, tap Visual Voicemail to turn it off. Alternatively, you can go to Settings > Apps > More Settings > Disable Forward (next to "When Unanswered, when busy, and When Unreached).
